org.epics.ioc.util
Interface EventScanner

public interface EventScanner

Event Scanner. This is implemented by ScannerFactory. It is the interface for records that are event scanned. Each event is identified by a eventName. A record can be event scanned and can also have a scheduling priority, which are defined by ScanPriority. When an event scanned record is started, the ScanField support calls EventScanner.addRecord. EventScanner manages a thread and list of records for each unique eventName,priority pair. When an announcer announces an event all records that are in a list for the associated eventName are processed.

Author:
mrk

Method Detail

addRecord

boolean addRecord(org.epics.pvData.pv.PVRecord pvRecord)
Add a record to be event scanned. The record must have a scan field and it must specify event scanning.

Parameters:
pvRecord - The record instance. This is called by ScanField only after the record instance has been merged into the master pvDatabase and the record instance has been started.
Returns:
false if the request failed or true if it was successful.

removeRecord

boolean removeRecord(org.epics.pvData.pv.PVRecord pvRecord,
                     java.lang.String eventName,
                     org.epics.pvData.misc.ThreadPriority scanPriority)
Remove the record from it's event scanned list. This is called by ScanField whenever any of the scan fields are modified or ScanField.stop is called.

Parameters:
pvRecord - The record instance.
eventName - The current event name.
scanPriority - The current priority.
Returns:
false if the request failed or true if it was successful.

addEventAnnouncer

EventAnnounce addEventAnnouncer(java.lang.String eventName,
                                java.lang.String announcer)
Add an event announcer.

Parameters:
eventName - The event name.
announcer - The name of the announcer.
Returns:
The EventAnnounce interface that the announcer calls.

removeEventAnnouncer

void removeEventAnnouncer(EventAnnounce eventAnnounce,
                          java.lang.String announcer)
Remove an event announcer.

Parameters:
eventAnnounce - The EventAnnounce returned by the call to addEventAnnounce.
announcer - The name of the announcer.
